questions.question: Can I have ……………………………… fruits?
questions.description: When we expect yes for an answer, some can be used in questions.

questions.question: ………………………….. of us was aware of the happenings.
questions.description: We use plural verbs with all and both. Nobody cannot be used with of us.

questions.question: Who spilled ……………………………. milk on the carpet?
questions.description: Here the emphasis is not on the quantity hence, much is not used. Many and a cannot be used with uncountable nouns like milk.

questions.question: I watched …………………………….. new films last week.
questions.description: Here many or a few is possible. Many indicates a large number a few indicates a small number. Both are grammatically correct here.

questions.question: ……………………………. people were injured in the accident.
questions.description: We can use several or a lot of here.

questions.question: She is …………………………….. cleverer than me.
questions.description: We can use a lot to modify comparative adjectives.

questions.question: I did hardly ………………………….. work yesterday.
questions.description: The correct expression is hardly any.

questions.question: There was not …………………………….. room on the bus, so we got off.
………………………………. of the eggs was in the basket.
questions.description: Use a plural verb with all and some.
